task_summary: Pick up the red object from the table using a robot arm. The behavior tree prioritizes reliable perception, approach, grasp, and safe lifting of the object.

task_long_description.overview: This episode shows a stationary robot arm performing a pick action on a task table. The main object is a red, cylindrical block placed on the table surface, distinguishable from nearby blue objects and marking tape. The robot must locate, approach, grasp, and raise this red object, handling transient failures in perception or grasp. All movements must be sequential and precise, focusing on the red object only.
preconditions: Red object is present and visible on table
Robot arm is initialized and unobstructed
stepwise_plan: Confirm visibility of red object or perform up to 3 scan attempts
Detect precise location of red object
Open the gripper to the correct width
Move above the red object with safe offset
Approach and align to the object with tight tolerance
Close gripper with moderate force to grasp
success_criteria: Red object stably grasped in gripper
Object raised above table with no slips or drops
failure_and_recovery: Object visibility fail: up to 3 scan retries
Grasp fail: no place or lift executed
Alignment or approach fail: abort cycle
Object not detected after retries: abort and report
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when red object is securely lifted above table at specified height.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if red object can be seen
Detects precise position of red object

failure_modes: Scan fails to locate red object
recovery_strategy: Retry scan for up to 3 attempts
Skip lift if object not grasped
assumptions: Frames [0]-[8] show pick only; frames do not show final place, so tree omits any place action.
Instruction mentions place, but frames contain only pick phase (red block not moved past last frame).
All objects are stable and unoccluded at start.
Object segmentation is robust despite similar color markers.

expected_success_criteria: Red object removed from table, held securely at lift height after frame_8
